chapters.name: Aditya Hridayam Stotram
chapters.summary: This chapter contains the complete Aditya Hridayam hymn, a powerful prayer dedicated to Surya, the Sun God. It was recited by Sage Agastya to Lord Rama on the battlefield to ensure his victory over Ravana. The hymn praises the Sun God's omnipotence, radiance, and life-giving energy, offering strength, courage, and prosperity to its reciter.

verses.original: दे॒वा व॑स्तो॒रि॒दं त्वा॒ नमो॒ विश्व॑दे॒वा म॒रुतो॒ ब्रह्म॒ सोमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: devā vastor idaṁ tvā namo viśvadevā maruto brahma somaḥ ||

translations.english: O Gods, this is for you. Salutations to the Visvedevas, the Maruts, Brahman, and Soma.
May the **sacrificial offerings** (Carvāṇi) be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: शन्न॑स्सो॒मो भ॑वतु॒ शं न॒ इन्द्रा॒ग्नी शं नः॒ पू॒षा शं नः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: śánnas sómo bhavatu śáṁ na indrāgnī śáṁ naḥ pūṣā́ śáṁ naḥ ||

translations.english: May **Soma** be auspicious to us, may **Indra and Agni** be auspicious to us, may **Pūṣan** be auspicious to us.
May **Heaven** (Dyaus) be mine, and the **Quarters** (Diśa) be mine. Salutations.
May **light** be mine, and **heaven** be mine. Salutations.

verses.original: स॒त्यं च॑ मे श्र॒द्धा च॑ मे॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: satyáṁ ca me śraddhā́ ca me namaḥ ||

translations.english: May **Truth** (Satyam) be mine, and **Faith** (Śraddhā) be mine. Salutations.
Salutations to the **Sacrificer** (Yajamāna) be mine. Salutations, salutations.

verses.original: शन्नो॑ वातः॒ शन्नो॑ भूमिः॒ शन्नः॑ सूर्यः॒ शन्नो॑ दे॒वः ॥
verses.transliteration: śanno vātaḥ śanno bhūmiḥ śannaḥ sūryaḥ śanno devaḥ ||

translations.english: May the **Wind** be auspicious to us, may the **Earth** be auspicious to us, may the **Sun** be auspicious to us, may the **Divine** be auspicious to us.

verses.original: य ईशा॑न॒स्य॒ भुवन॑स्य वि॒राट् इ॒ह स॑र्वव्या॒पी नम॑स्सदाशि॒वाय॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: ya īśānasyā bhuvanasya virāṭ iha sarvavyāpī namassadāśivāya ||

translations.english: He who is the Sovereign Ruler of the universe, the all-pervading one here. Salutations to Sadashiva.

verses.original: नमस्ते॑ अस्तु भगवन् विश्वेश्वराय महादे॒वाय॑ त्र्यम्ब॒काय॑ त्रिपुरान्त॒काय॑ त्रिकाग्निका॒लाय॑ कालाग्निरु॒द्राय॑ नीलक॒ण्ठाय॑ मृत्युञ्ज॒याय॑ सर्वेश्व॒राय॑ सदाशि॒वाय॑ श्रीमन्म॒हादे॒वाय॒ नमः॑ ॥
verses.transliteration: namaste astu bhagavan viśveśvarāya mahādevāya tryambakāya tripurāntakāya trikāgnikālāya kālāgnirudrāya nīlakaṇṭhāya mṛtyuñjayāya sarveśvarāya sadāśivāya śrīmanmahādevāya namaḥ ||

translations.english: Salutations to Thee, O Lord, the Lord of the universe, the Great God, the three-eyed one, the destroyer of Tripura, the annihilator of the three fires, Rudra as the fire of time, the blue-throated one, the conqueror of death, the Lord of all, the ever-auspicious one, the glorious Great God. Salutations.

verses.original: च॒न्द्रम॑श्च मे सू॒र्यश्च॑ मे म॒ृत्युश्च॑ मे॒ जीवा॑तुश्च मे ॥
verses.transliteration: candrámaśca me sū́ryaśca me mṛtyúśca me jīvātuśca me ||

translations.english: May the **Moon** be mine, and the **Sun** be mine, and **death** (conquered) be mine, and **life** be mine.
May they be **established** by the sacrifice. Salutations.
